No homeless dog will ever pass up the opportunity to find a master that care for them. Dogs instinctively follow the commands of a human, this isn't learnt as even puppies will follow the commands when they can find the concentration to do so. When humans look at another human face we start by gathering visual cues from the right side of the face, dogs are the only other animal that do this and they only do this toward humans. Human eyes have a lot of eye white, this is useful when you want to know where someone is looking. Dogs also have eye white and is one of the few animals that actually have this, it mostly evolved just because dogs lived with humans.

Jail? Well, you would have, had that dog instead been a 12 month old child. I typically think of the moral importance of human life being related to the qualities of our conscious mind. Whatever it is specifically, it seems that a dog is remarkably similar in all respects to an infant human.
